title: Off Meta supports?
body:
What do you think about off meta supports?
Is there anybody else who enjoy to play {{champion:34}} ,{{champion:63}} ,{{champion:127}} ,{{champion:78}} ,{{champion:106}}  as supports? If yes, I would like to find out more ideas for some fun supports to play, because I played a lot {{champion:89}} and {{champion:201}} and I get bored of them. And maybe you could say something about your play style with an off meta support and eventually some usual builds that you make on them.

replies.body:
Poppy is pretty good as a supp. 

I love malphite support. 

I used to orgasam over xerath support. (Played it to mch)

Oh and taric, just because people underestimate him.

Maokai support is great. Great all-in and peeling, as well as long range slow to catch up to enemy or slow down a chasing enemy.
He also has mini-wards in his kit, which is pretty sweet.

Every once in a blue moon I will play {{champion:101}} support.  He works pretty well as he is really good at poking the enemy.  Has a stun and Slow and lots of AoE for 2v2.  Add on to that he can self sustain his mana really well and it works pretty good.  His biggest downside is that he is immobile and can be punished pretty heavily for it.
ive done jax support his stun is pretty good if you know how to time it

I love me some {{champion:63}} support. He can be a bit toxic tho as is has a really bad habit of taking most the kills, not that thats an issue to winning as a fed brand can really be a boon in teamfights, but that dont be surprised when you adc flames you 4/0/0 score in lane. 

My advice is that UNLESS YOU GET AHEAD by a decent margin, i mean a really good early game, not just a kill or two, dont try to build into AP to much and focus more on CDR, MS, mana and basic support utility stuff. The exception is that L's Torment is suuuuper good on him when combined with his passive as that item alone with it means you will always do solid damage.

Oh and always get {{item:3303}}. The tick damage of your passive will give you all 3 triggers of it whenever you land anything, hell he may actually be a champ that can get decent results with full {{item:3092}} even.

I played Brand as support a few times and I enjoyed him, but the problem is, if I don't get ahead, I feel useless. I build ap tanky items, such as {{item:3151}} and {{item:3116}} and my usual build on him as support looks pretty similar to my build when I play mid, except {{item:3303}} and {{item:2049}}.  Thank you for the comment, maybe I'll try to build {{item:3050}} {{item:3060}} as well.

{{champion:14}} Sion.
great CC, and tower pushing. Transitions to late game brusier.
Rush {{item:3401}} , {{item:2049}} , and then {{item:3074}} . The rest as you wish.
Face of the Mountain can give you great heals from Q, and can also proc while dead, to continue the rampage.
The hydra is for damage (people expect it of you), and the AOE lifesteal does wonders for Sion's passive.

I also play {{champion:432}} . He's definitely not for everyone, but if nothing else I'd say to practice with him just to become more map aware. You roam pretty often, and are constantly checking minimap for chimes, so just practice making the most of those two and it'll help.
Also, bard ganks are brutal. R --> walk on over -->Q stun -->auto--> W ally --> by the time you finish that much most allies will have had plenty of time to nuke them to ****.
Oh, and for 1st time Bard players, each chime lasts about 10 minutes, so there's no rush to grab them if they are far away. just wait till there are 4 or so in one area. You usually have time to make big sweeps for them after a gank or teamfight.
----
EDIT:
I've also had {{champion:103}} used against me bot lane, and the charm is brutal.
Thanks for your comment. Bard isn't my type of champion, neither Ahri. I like tanky champions with decent cc, like Sion I'll try Sion as support soon.

{{champion:90}} support is quite interesting. Like Brand, he can proc spellthief 3 times with one ability. 
His voidlings can block skillshots (and dance). 
If you duo with a Quinn adc you can effectively prevent your opponent(s) from fighting back for 2 seconds (silence + blind). 
Voidlings can tank turrets for diving or pushing purposes. Your ult is pretty much a free kill. 
Once you get rylai's you have a near perma-slow (4 second DoT = 5 second slow with E alone).
You have good base damage so ap isn't all that necessary.
Your voidlings can tank dragon for easy early dragon kills.

However, you have no escapes. You need to push to get mana back but the adc can still last hit the minions affected by your E. You have no hard cc pre-6. Your team probably won't like it so you may need to duo with an adc who also plays Malzahar.
